channel.title: Building a laptop
channel.description: Hello, I am going to attempt to build a laptop. I have some ideas on the parts I will need, and I know what goes where, but one of the biggest issues I'm having is finding barebone parts, retailers, and the actual laptop case(not sure what it's called really) so I was wondering if you guys had any ideas. Also, I'm in America, i know alot more barebones parts are un the UK

item.title: Building a laptop
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Even if you really were going to do this, which you’re not. It wouldn’t work. Laptop cases are designed for specific internals, and it’s interchangeable. By the time you bought all the individual parts for a laptop, you’d of saved money just to buy it outright.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a laptop
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

zyle1992:

Just to say that I built a custom laptop. and I don’t know of any laptops with 1 tb hdds.

You have the freedom to put a good processor/chipset/RAM in it and all you want is a stupidly huge HDD?

Read full topic

item.title: Building a laptop
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

It’s going to be more expensive than buying one prebuilt (or custom built online), so what exactly is your motivation for doing this?

Read full topic
